## Description {#details}

Superclass for all disassemblers.

Consumes a memory region and provides an array of assembly instructions.

Definition at line 84 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h">MCDisassembler.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::MCDisassembler::DecodeStatus ">
Ternary decode status.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aa537a26dac8694f2000c729a35e2ead30" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Fail">
 (= 0)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aa9d693b8e530a7fa3457dece6f8951e6c" />
<EnumerationListItem name="SoftFail">
 (= 1)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aaabe09036b442fff9aa63ce1e844fdf60" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Success">
 (= 3)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Most backends will just use Fail and Success, however some have a concept of an instruction with understandable semantics but which is architecturally incorrect. An example of this is <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a> UNPREDICTABLE instructions which are disassemblable but cause undefined behaviour.

Because it makes sense to disassemble these instructions, there is a &quot;soft fail&quot; failure mode that indicates the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a>&amp; is valid but architecturally incorrect.

The enum numbers are deliberately chosen such that reduction from Success-&gt;SoftFail -&gt;Fail can be done with a simple bitwise-AND:

LEFT &amp; TOP = | Success Unpredictable Fail -----------—+--------------------------------— Success | Success Unpredictable Fail Unpredictable | Unpredictable Unpredictable Fail Fail | Fail Fail Fail

An easy way of encoding this is as 0b11, 0b01, 0b00 for Success, SoftFail, Fail respectively.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h/#l00108">108</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h">MCDisassembler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### getInstruction() {#a938eec53ce08249709acf1b3ec7f4035}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual DecodeStatus llvm::MCDisassembler::getInstruction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> &amp; Instr, uint64&#95;t &amp; Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Bytes, uint64&#95;t Address, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp; CStream) const</>}>
Returns the disassembly of a single instruction.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Instr">- An <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcinst">MCInst</a> to populate with the contents of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">- A value to populate with the size of the instruction, or the number of bytes consumed while attempting to decode an invalid instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Address">- The address, in the memory space of region, of the first byte of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Bytes">- A reference to the actual bytes of the instruction.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="CStream">- The stream to print comments and annotations on.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- <a href="#a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aaabe09036b442fff9aa63ce1e844fdf60">MCDisassembler::Success</a> if the instruction is valid, <a href="#a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aa9d693b8e530a7fa3457dece6f8951e6c">MCDisassembler::SoftFail</a> if the instruction was disassemblable but invalid, <a href="#a8eb822283e8f3200ca4b2a1ba0174e6aa537a26dac8694f2000c729a35e2ead30">MCDisassembler::Fail</a> if the instruction was invalid.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h/#l00134">134</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h">MCDisassembler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition

### onSymbolStart() {#a433d519ca0c3f0c4fd434168aded199f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; bool &gt; MCDisassembler::onSymbolStart (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/symbolinfoty">SymbolInfoTy</a> &amp; Symbol, uint64&#95;t &amp; Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Bytes, uint64&#95;t Address) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Used to perform separate target specific disassembly for a particular symbol.

May parse any prelude that precedes instructions after the start of a symbol, or the entire symbol. This is used for example by <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/webassembly">WebAssembly</a> to decode preludes.

Base implementation returns false. So all targets by default decline to treat symbols separately.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Symbol">- The symbol.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">- The number of bytes consumed.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Address">- The address, in the memory space of region, of the first byte of the symbol.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Bytes">- A reference to the actual bytes at the symbol location.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- True if this symbol triggered some target specific disassembly for this symbol. Size must be set with the number of bytes consumed.
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> if this symbol triggered some target specific disassembly for this symbol, but an error was found with it. Size must be set with the number of bytes consumed.</li>
<li>False if the target doesn&#39;t want to handle the symbol separately. The value of Size is ignored in this case, and Err must not be set.</li>
</ul>
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h/#l00160">160</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h">MCDisassembler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-cpp/#l00016">16</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-cpp">MCDisassembler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setABIVersion() {#a3cf91780885aa39f09d87eb711c82607}

### setSymbolizer() {#a78e81a66b1e9430bc28c8d3cfe75de2d}

This takes ownership of <code>Symzer</code>, and deletes the previously set one.

### suggestBytesToSkip() {#a7c1ac522bf9b5a8b411e9d78ed69e4b2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint64&#95;t MCDisassembler::suggestBytesToSkip (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Bytes, uint64&#95;t Address) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Suggest a distance to skip in a buffer of data to find the next place to look for the start of an instruction.

For example, if all instructions have a fixed alignment, this might advance to the next multiple of that alignment.

If not overridden, the default is 1.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Address">- The address, in the memory space of region, of the starting point (typically the first byte of something that did not decode as a valid instruction at all).</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Bytes">- A reference to the actual bytes at Address. May be needed in order to determine the width of an unrecognized instruction (e.g. in Thumb this is a simple consistent criterion that doesn&#39;t require knowing the specific instruction). The caller can pass as much data as they have available, and the function is required to make a reasonable default choice if not enough data is available to make a better one.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- A number of bytes to skip. Must always be greater than zero. May be greater than the size of Bytes.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h/#l00192">192</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/include/llvm/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-h">MCDisassembler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-cpp/#l00023">23</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcdisassembler/mcdisassembler-cpp">MCDisassembler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
